alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kennebec County through 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Livermore Falls, or 15 miles southwest of Oakland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waterville, Fairfield, Oakland, Belgrade, Manchester, Chesterville, Fayette, Sidney, Rome, Mount Vernon, Vassalboro, Vienna, Readfield, Wayne, Smithfield and Winslow. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 117 and 128. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Great Pong and nearby lakes, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
